page.title: 08COMMUNITY LIFE (2)
page.content:
{THE VICTORY CLUB } The Victory Club was built in {1923,}3 years before the{Memorial {Hall}was built. A joiner took{5 years to build it. It was originally built for the same reason as the Memorial Hall, to commemorate the victory of the First World War, hence the name {'The Victory Club'. It is now used just as a club for drinks and discos.
{THE MEMORIAL PIT COTTAGES { }The Memorial Pit Cottages were built in memory of the{Hester Pit {disaster.}They were built in{1910. People are still living in these cottages and they keep them in good condition.
